references.reason: This paper provides foundational knowledge on molecular dynamics simulation, a core method used in the research.

references.paper_title: A microscopic theory for antiphase boundary motion and its application to antiphase domain coarsening
references.reason: This paper presents a seminal theory on antiphase boundary motion, relevant to the study of material properties and phase transitions.

references.paper_title: Equation-free, coarse-grained multiscale computation: enabling microscopic simulators to perform system-level analysis
references.reason: This paper introduces equation-free modeling, a crucial method for bridging microscopic and macroscopic scales in complex systems.

references.paper_title: Data-driven discovery of coordinates and governing equations
references.reason: This paper provides a data-driven approach to learn macroscopic dynamics, which is the core method used in the research.

references.paper_title: Machine learning of coarse-grained molecular dynamics force fields
references.reason: This paper introduces machine learning methods for coarse-grained molecular dynamics, enhancing the efficiency and accuracy of simulations.
